results.title: Clothing: a pair of blue jeans
results.creator_credit: Mark Harris, George Kaczender and International Cinemedia Centre, Montreal
results.brief_description: Takes a pair of jeans as an item of clothing to provide basis for a lesson in economics and clothing manufacture. Uses a lyrical ballad to illustrate the concepts, following the process of making jeans from cotton fields to the boy who buys the new pair, together with a brief history of the garments.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Harris, George Kaczender and International Cinemedia Centre, Montreal

results.title: Clothespeak
results.creator_credit: Margaret Williams, Fiz Oliver and Arbor Films
results.brief_description: Looks at established youth style groups such as Mods, Skinheads, Punks and the New Romantics. Illustrates the importance of style to such groups and aims to eliminate preconceptions about people whose appearance is out of the ordinary. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Clothes around the world
results.brief_description: Illustrates the variation from country to country in the style of clothes worn and how it is influenced by climate, available materials and the individueal preferences of the people who wear them.

results.title: Close encounters of the sexual kind (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Contraception: ready or not” addressing myths, facts and attitudes towards sexually transmitted diseases. Designed to encourage a responsible attitude towards sex and contraception and the prevention of STD’s. The issues raised include AIDS, the need for medical check-ups, communication and condoms.

results.title: Climbing plants
results.brief_description: A study of climbing plants, including such “scramblers” as the bramble and the rose; the leaf-holding clematis, the canary creeper, the root climbing ivy, etc.

results.title: Clever Hiko Ichi
results.brief_description: Provides a backdrop for language arts activities such as storytelling, creative dramatics, and reading, by presenting an animated story about a little boy in medieval Japan who solves three difficult problems with a bit of applied science and personal fortitude.

results.title: Clearing up the weather
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Rob Gell, well known weather forecaster and former lecturer in Geography, discusses the weather with Peter Couchman. He describes what causes particular weather patterns, looks at various types of storm activity, and discusses “El Nino” and the “Greenhouse Effect”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education

results.title: Claymation: three dimensional clay animation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton, Susan Shadburne, Pyramid Films and Will Vinton Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the principles and processes of three dimensional clay animation. Shows the mixing of colour, creation of characters that move, production and editing of the live action film which serves as an animation guide, music scoring and the slow demanding process of working with the clay itself. Includes scenes from “Closed Monday” and “Martin the Cobbler”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Will Vinton, Susan Shadburne, Pyramid Films and Will Vinton Productions
results.description: Demonstrates the principles and processes of three dimensional clay animation. results.title: Classroom crisis: dealing with violence in school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dave Bell, Bruce Johnson and Dave Bell Associates
results.brief_description: Violence presents a real danger for teachers. Dr. Fred Feitler of Youngstown State University has developed strategies for dealing with student fights, physical assaults, disciplinary confrontations and other crisis situations.
